programme.title: Margaret

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: How an ex-prisoner who sought revenge against a guard over a petty grudge was caught. And police are re-appealing for information on the murder of Michelle Bettles, who was killed in 2002.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Never mind about stairs up to the bedrooms, wheres the front door?? Dion has to figure it out in a three-bedroom mid-terrace in South Yorkshire. Tommy is in east London to deal with a knotty problem in the garden at a one-bedroom flat. And Martel is in Darlington to navigate her way around a nicotine-stained terrace.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Great Scott! Roo Irvine gets behind the wheel of a DeLorean DMC-12, the car that famously featured as a time machine in the 1985 hit movie, Back to the Future. Built on the peace lines in Northern Ireland, the DMC-12s design was ahead of its time, with its angular, stainless-steel bodywork and eye-catching, gull-wing doors. At the Ulster Transport Museum, Roo meets two men who test-drove the first cars to come off the production line.

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The metal detecting team are desperate to find a treasured heirloom for a heartbroken family - lost at an ancient stone circle just north of the Lake District. Crafter Lucy takes on some of our smelliest rubbish, and social media detective Mui hopes to get a lost possession back on its owners wrist.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah marvels at the majesty of Perth and Kinross, as she helps a couple from a large town on Englands south coast to find their dream country escape in Scotland. With their house-hunting budget of £425,000, lots of bookshelves, or places for them, are a top priority.

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Judi Love for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: This Is BBC THREE
programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Did you know that the Victorians invented films? Not only that, but one of the first stars of the moving image was Queen Victoria. Using real footage recently restored by the BFI, this special show takes a look at the Victorians obsession with film. We see some of Queen Vickys very first filmic appearances (also featuring an initially reluctant Tsar Nicholas I), and also how the Victorians became obsessed with filming everything.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Viking Eye for the Straight Guy
programme.desc: From the ancient Egyptians pioneering smelling good (a heady mix of fat and perfume plonked on your head, so that it would gradually melt throughout the day and make you smell all lovely and fragrant), to Coco Chanel turning fashion for women on its head, this show brings you the Horrible History of looking good. Featuring some of fashions greatest innovations, pioneers, and victims, we look at how the way people have dressed has had an impact on their lives.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Birminghams Hockley Social Club has been transformed into our very own comedy club. Taking to the stage are Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh in a bid to impress our judges and book their place in the final. Award-winning comedian and writer Sarah Keyworth is here to keep the house in order. The judges are comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri completes the trio.

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Her world rocked, Evie has retreated to the safety of the garage. But with a new understanding, Suz and Izzie create a unique version of Film Club to bring back Evies smile.

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Noa didnt want a big goodbye, but now the days finally come for him to leave, will Evie let him go that easily? Its not the only big decision she has to face...

programme.title: The Boogeyman
programme.desc: Still grieving over the recent death of his wife, a therapist and his two young daughters encounter a terrifying supernatural entity that preys on families and feeds on the suffering of its victims.

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student film-makers, Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Mike Williams, set off into the woods near Burkitsville, Maryland, in search of the truth behind the legends of the Blair Witch. They never returned but, a year later, their footage was found.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared. Are they ready to re-ignite their love, or is it one final near miss?

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit on `Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows it is his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. If the day goes well, it could catapult his career, but if it goes badly, it is game over.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena must ask Simon for a favour, but at a price. With his dream within reach, Kwabena has big choices to make.

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: A vibrant new sketch show created by and starring Danielle Vitalis. Meet the driving instructor from hell, a trifling West Indian judge, and the podcaster who will say sorry for anything if it means more money and more followers.

programme.title: Horrible Histories

It?s also full of idiots working together to create an unholy mess, and people forming partnerships for decidedly sinister reasons, welcome to Horrible Histories? Chaotic Collabs. programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent in California pursues a gang of bank robbers known as the `Ex-Presidents, who lead him to the LA surfing scene and an adrenaline junkie who lives for thrills. The cop soon finds that he is being seduced by the fast-paced lifestyle of his new mentor.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th birthday of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern, £500,000 interpretation of this classic sports car before putting on a typically low key birthday party involving live music, classic fighter planes and a group of Royal Marines. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond is in South Africa to test a rugged alternative to the famous Hummer.

programme.title: Zen School of Motoring
programme.desc: Ogmios discusses light-creepers, those scoundrels who creep forwards beyond the white line when the traffic lights are red. As part of his lesson on roundabouts, he takes a trip to Swindon to visit one of the worlds greatest roundabouts.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Birminghams Hockley Social Club has been transformed into our very own comedy club. Taking to the stage are Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh in a bid to impress our judges and book their place in the final. Award-winning comedian and writer Sarah Keyworth is here to keep the house in order. The judges are comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri completes the trio.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul makes the trip across the pond in search of the queen with the most charisma, uniqueness, nerve and talent in the United Kingdom, setting the contestants a series of challenges week by week.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The hills of Carmarthenshire are the setting for a shopping showdown between two teams of bargain hunters, while Roo Irvine learnes about the centuries-old craft of making chain mail.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: In a battle of patter, its host Matthew Wright v stand-up Shazia Mirza, who road trip around Essex in an electric 1966 Mercedes with experts David Harper and Steven Moore.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: World Championship Artistic Gymnastics LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the 2025 World Gymnastics Championships.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: From India to Australia, all life awaits the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The sun baked continent causes hot air to rise, sucking moist monsoon winds in from the coast and dramatic electrical storms herald the first rains.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The experts visit Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House, Herstmonceux Castle and Reading Town Hall to track down fascinating antiques. Plus, Paul Martin uncovers the colourful characters of the historic Ugbrooke family in Devon.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Kola Bokinni, Sheli McCoy, John Parrott and Katie Piper test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Janette Manrara has an exciting guide through all the backstage ballroom action, with more couples stopping by for a chat. Plus an exclusive first look at how some of the celebrities are handling their next dances.

programme.title: The Crash Detectives
programme.desc: The collision team investigate a late-night crash on an unlit dual carriageway but are stunned to discover the seriously injured man was travelling on an electric scooter.

programme.title: Jules and Gregs Wild Swim
programme.desc: Jules and Greg dive into Harris breathtaking beaches, pick up some conversational Gaelic and experience a once-in-a-lifetime magical cave swim with seals off the coast of Lewis.

programme.title: Tropic of Cancer
programme.desc: Simon rejoins the Tropic in Egypt and follows it through Saudi Arabia, Dubai, and Oman. In Southern Egypt, next to the ancient temple of Abu Simbal, Simon meets Nubians struggling to maintain their culture following the damming of the Nile and dives in the pristine reefs of the Red Sea.

programme.title: Fake or Fortune?
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and Philip Mould investigate a picturesque outdoor scene of women in a field sold at auction in England in the style of Helen Galloway McNicoll, one of Canadas most important impressionist painters.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by the latest banished and murdered players as he tells them the identity of the Traitors for the first time.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBCs range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain
programme.sub-title: San Sebastian and the Basque Country
programme.desc: Eva Longoria travels to the Basque Country where San Sebastians imaginative cuisine reflects a proud cultural heritage and culinary mastery.

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: Four psychic researchers investigate Hill House, a mansion with an infamous reputation for supernatural phenomena.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the players fall deeper into the game, a new day brings new suspicions amongst the Faithful. The mission forces the celebrities to communicate in a way no-one expected, and with the murdering hour approaching, the players take their seats at the Round Table. Will the Faithful work as a team to uncover a Traitor, or will the Traitors power grow stronger?

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by the latest banished and murdered celebrity Players as theyre told the identity of the Traitors for the very first time...

programme.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
programme.desc: Much to Trevors irritation, a rare phoenix woodpecker takes a liking to him. He demands an immediate quest to return the bird to its real home.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings improvise a trampoline with bagpipes, only each jump is accompanied by a deafening outburst. Grizzy steps in and hurls the object far from the castle.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy puts a stop to the Lemmings furious rodeo game on a sheep. Annoyed, they decide to banish the bear to the bottom of the castle dungeons while hes taking a nap.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When a gang of kids steals the Krusty Krabs grill, SpongeBob and Mr Krabs go to extreme lengths to win it back.

programme.title: Odd Squad

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Two aspiring warrior-heroes and a lively ghost girl refine the skills they need to take the place of an ageing monster-slayer by completing his odd, supernatural chores.

programme.title: Bitesize: 9-11 Year Olds
programme.desc: Learn about negative numbers and adding and subtracting.

His mum and dad are getting fed up of the oil he gets everywhere. Campbell needs a cycling den where he can cycle all over the world without getting oil on his parents sofa!

Meanwhile across the world, discover Chinese technology light years ahead of the dunderheaded Normans.

programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy white dandelions in the park. After blowing all the seeds off, but one of them, Bing decides to take the last one as a present to Sula. As they set off across the park Bing negotiates many windy, wobbly hazards to keep the dandelion safe.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: When the lights go out in the Home Dome, the Teletubbies get the giggles! The lights come back on again and theres Tubby Custard mess everywhere.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea freezes the Veggies so she can take over the whole supermarket. Chillis heat unfreezes Supertato, who then races on lolly-stick skis to thwart Evil Pea and save the day.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, its the spectacular acrobatic grapes working together to perform the most difficult structures to perfection.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo is eager to get a new picture of Tee for her wall.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Coco are drawing Gilly a picture. When she and Popsie arrive, Bing goes to say hello, but while he does so Charlie makes a big squiggle on Bings drawing. Gilly shows them a game called `squiggling. You draw a squiggle, and then your partner turns that squiggle into a new drawing. Bing loves this game and turns Charlies squiggle into Popsie.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Blue meets Deep Blue and Sky Blue and learns all about their favourite things. They embark on an adventure in a submarine to the depths of the deep blue sea and take a trip up in a plane to discover all about sky blue items.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels find a treasure map inside Duggees big shiny ruby. X marks the spot!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: A severe weather warning from Duggees barometer leads the Squirrels to round up all the creatures they can find outside and pile into the clubhouse for an impromptu party, earning their Get Indoors badges in the process!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey promises her customer, Bingo, the best tour ever in a game of Whale Watching, but they need Mum and Dad to join in, and they are too tired to play after a late night.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad and Uncle Stripe play a game of squash, Bluey and Bingo pretend that they are in control of their every move. Bingo proves that big siblings dont always beat little siblings.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Lars sees a mysterious creature near the Academy jungle and rushes to tell the others. Ubercorn explains that new species are discovered all the time, so this could be something that no one has seen before. He also tells them that new species are often named after the person who finds them. Excited by the prospect of lending their name to this mysterious creature, the Go Jetters, Grandmaster Glitch and Tala head out on a jungle expedition, but something seems to be watching them.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: After Old Brown snatches her, Cotton-tail gets stuck up a tree. Its up to Peter, Lily and Benjamin to rescue her before either a passing Mr Tod seizes her or the angry Owl returns.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts expand their exploration beyond the sea - and onto land. With new rides and new friends, they are prepared to protect any habitats and animals at risk on land or under the water.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Its Numberblock Seventeens area art challenge! Who can find the area of a canvas?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Its big bop night at the Alphadrome, but bossy bass player B falls out with drummer D over musical differences. She doesnt need her brother to make the blocks boogie, does she?

programme.title: Nick Copes Popcast
programme.desc: Nick is trying his best to bake a special cake for Grandmas birthday but things dont go to plan. The Popcasters tell him to keep on trying and hell get there in the end.

programme.title: Justins House
programme.desc: Justin, Robert and Little Monster try to protect Gems jewels from naughty Captain Sinker when the stars of Swashbuckle drop in for Pirate Day. Guest starring Gemma Hunt and Ella Kenion.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sulas cousin Nicky is visiting, something Bing is a little unsure about. Sula and Bing start making rippy pictures, and while Sula is looking for some purple paper Bing shows Nicky how to voosh the blue speedy car down the slide. However, Nicky vooshes too, falling and breaking his glasses! Sula is furious and Bing is forlorn. Amma soothes Bing while Nicky shows him that he can click his glasses back together again.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say mouse and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. Dee meets lots of different mice. She meets a brown mouse, a furry mouse and a whiskery mouse. Theres a squeaky mouse, a cheeky mouse and a sleepy mouse.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Lu and Declan race their home toys and Declan accidentally bumps Lus toy, Emma, into the shelf. He and Lu get a bandaid for Emma and create a toy hospital.

programme.title: Piggy Builders
programme.desc: Its Bear Berry Day! The Piggy Builders come up with a way to help Brian reach the top of the tree to pick berries on the special day, but Wilf wants the berries too.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos find themselves in an office. Thy spin the office chairs round and round.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin is at the beach, where he has lots of fun with his new friends. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble is packing up the car for a day out but might have a few unexpected extra passengers.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Laa-Laa has fun watching Dipsy stretch up, like a very tall tower. The Tubby Toaster goes crazy and fires out lots of Tubby Toast, which ends up in a tall tower too.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies George, Inam, Isaac, Hunter, Luther, Billie and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Inside everyones bags in this episode are paintbrushes which are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding an appropriate paintbrush inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The fun song Finger Family features, as does a story involving Baby Bear.

programme.title: I Spy, You Spy
programme.desc: Elsee plays I Spy with her friend Bailey in his back garden.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: A bicycle ride with Dad soon turns into an intergalactic space adventure.

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the magician wants to do the biggest magic trick ever, but when he makes everyone disappear, he has to figure out how to bring them all back!

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.desc: While Kiri is playing with Rockaroonie, Lou sees an island in the middle of the lake thats completely covered in flowers. How can he get there?

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo loves rough-housing with Dad, but sometimes he forgets Bingo is smaller than her sister. Mum shows Bingo how to use her big girl bark to alert the family to her limits.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has written a list of activities for the Squirrels, but hes misplaced the piece of paper. First, the Squirrels learn what a list is, then they try to recreate Duggees for him, but things dont quite work out in his favour.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchers arrive on a planet populated by trumpet-nosed aliens.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: When Yabba wont play with Timmy he decides to make a new playmate out of plasticine. Yabba is hurt when Timmy rejects her offers of friendship and snubs her in favour of his new best friend - but is an imaginary friend as much fun as a real one?

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Amanpreet challenges her sister Amrit to a biking competition to see who can cycle around the bike track the fastest. The bikes get really muddy, so Amanpreet takes charge of giving them a good clean and has some splashy fun.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Valentina is making a Greek vegetarian moussaka for her friends because her family is from Greece. Her delicious recipe is loaded with fresh vegetables such as courgettes and aubergines and topped with green lentils packed with goodness. She finishes it off by making a yoghurt topping and covering everything with grated cheese. Some of Valentinas friends dont like the taste of cooked aubergine on its own.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Elena finds out all about marvellous moths. Chantelle is with Dr Amir Khan to see one of the worlds biggest moths while Rory and his son Sandy are in disguise being moth spies.

programme.title: Whats on Your Head?
programme.desc: Sharmin, who is a Muslim, tells us all about her hijab and why she chose to wear one.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.desc: Its Miss Gerrards birthday, and the children plan a surprise party for her. Felicity and Coen are the chefs. Theyre in charge of baking and decorating a delicious birthday cake, with help from Mrs Bailey. Theo and Jasper are making a beautiful birthday crown for Miss Gerrard to wear, and have asked Mrs Hussain to help them. With everything ready, its time for the surprise party!

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three extraordinary machines that you can actually live in. Grace goes for a sail in a solar-powered canal boat, shows off the International Space Station and goes for a drive in a motorhome.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `gloves and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different types of gloves, green gloves, gold gloves, woolly gloves, fingerless gloves and glowing gloves.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The number friends take turns hiding behind each other in a song and dance all about bigger and smaller. Learn about comparing numbers with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Its Os birthday, but R has forgotten to get him a present! Can she magic up a big wheel, a helter skelter and a hall of mirrors from thin air?

programme.title: Wonderblocks
programme.desc: The Wonderblocks help Arty figure out the right directions to cross some stepping stones.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Its lunchtime in Colourland! Red invites her friends for lunch, where they try each others favourite foods.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: King Tiger interrupts the Squirrels quiet time when he turns up to the Clubhouse with a magic hat on instead of his crown. King Tiger puts on a magic show for the Squirrels, making things appear and disappear to the Squirrels enthusiastic requests. The magic hat creates things from small to big, from mice to an elephant. The Squirrels are amazed, and the show is going well until the elephant lands on the hat, breaking it!

programme.title: Yukee
programme.desc: Its been snowing, and Yukee and her garden friends use music and beat to build a big snow band.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Meet some cute alpacas with Justin and his friend as they visit a farm, while Mr Tumble, Grandad Tumble and Aunt Polly sing Old MacDonald at the farmyard dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky and Laa-Laa are in Home Dome when the Tubby Phone rings. Its Dipsy and Po calling from the Tubby Mobile to say hello.

programme.title: Andys Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Andy heads to a Caribbean island to track down some hermit crabs and their shells.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Dougs tooth has fallen out, so Jess and Simon tell Waffle about the Tooth Fairy. Waffle longs to meet the Tooth Fairy and his dream comes true.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks stall. She chooses the fairy wand and remembers the day she got it... James asks the kids what wish they would make if they could wish for anything at all. Suki wants to be a vet, Magnus wants to build a robot and Ruby wants to feed pigs. Molly says she would like to be a fairy godmother and make all of her friends wishes come true. She persuades Daisy to take Suki and Ruby to the farm.

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: Raa Raa is looking for something new in the Jingly Jangly Jungle. He is so busy looking, he doesnt spot all the strange new things going on around him.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers land on a seabed-like planet, where they meet three alien children whose favourite game is "Command Colour".

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When a floating garbage patch endangers a flock of pelicans and other sea creatures, the Octonauts and the birds work together to clean it up.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Hazelnut Raid
programme.desc: When Peter accidentally destroys the squirrels store of nuts with one of Mr Bouncers misfiring inventions, he sets off to perilous Owl Island to replace them!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: A dancing bug lands on Duggees head, and he cant stop dancing. The Squirrels take a close look and see that its a tiny hillbilly bug with a fiddle. Whats more, hes got a whole band with him - the Hillbilly Bug Band.

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: When Zigzag hurts her foot on the job, Vida is there to help fix it. However, Zigzag still has to deliver her packages in time for Vidas surprise Vet Day party.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea challenges the Tato Team to a football match but cheats with her cheaty boots.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard and Cosima create a fantastic water ride when they dislodge an underwater rock blocking a volcanic vent. Its all good fun until they realise the sea is starting to change.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Jacksons big, blue chicken-thing, Ludwig, is going to lay an egg. And its up to Mojo and Bo to carry the big bird across dangerous roads to Prestons egg-hatching shed!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey promises her customer, Bingo, the best tour ever in a game of Whale Watching, but they need Mum and Dad to join in, and they are too tired to play after a late night.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: When Millie hosts a series of tough penguin games, Pancake and Nugget must stick together.

programme.title: Dodges Pup School
programme.desc: Miss Collie brings her pet stick insect, Woody, to class, but halfway through the day, Woody mysteriously vanishes! Dodge, Woofer, and Jazz spring into action, convinced a pup has taken him, and launch an investigation to track down the culprit. Just as Dodge thinks hes cracked the case, they discover Woody was in his tank all along, showing off some surprising skills!

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Brooklyn-Bells are looking after the kitten from Jesss veterinary practice. When Waffle checks on the kitten, its not in its bed. In fact, the kitten is nowhere to be seen. The Brooklyn-Bells dont see it disappear into the utility cupboard and through the tunnel to Mrs Hobbss house next door. When Mrs Hobbs meets the kitten, she mistakes it for her beloved cat George. She falls in love with the kitten and doesnt want it to leave.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Whilst Oona and Isabelle seek a glimpse of a Cattle Egret, Baba discovers a fascinating miniature world along the journey.

programme.sub-title: Autumn: Its Time for a Surprise
programme.desc: JoJo, Gran Gran and Panda are helping Cynthia in her garden. Cynthia gives JoJo a present of some sunflower seeds which she can keep ready to plant and grow next year. When she gets home, JoJo decides it would be nice to give Cynthia a surprise.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: While all of the friends stay busy in the little Toy House, Colly Wobble decides its time to play a silly song. Everyone loves the silly song and they all dance along.

programme.desc: Henry Cole, Simon OBrien and Max McMurdo travel across the UK to find unique items lost in peoples homes to fix up for a profit. This episode features a pedal car and toy yacht.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Les Dennis in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Siblings Michael and Catherine are pooling their resources to buy a holiday home in Manilva on Spains Costa del Sol. Jean Johansson shows them what £175k can buy.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Normandy village owners Paul and Yip consider selling up. And we catch up with Roberto, whose record-breaking bridge linking two ghost villages in Italy is almost ready to open.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alicia hosts the third visit of the week at her BandB in West Sussex, where the relaxed mood is pierced at evening drinks by an argument over online reviews.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Cardiff, Charlotte serves a homely hug of a dinner, but things turn spooky. Will the prize be a ghostly apparition?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Phil and Paula scour Barcelona to bag a beloved bolthole. After viewing a place with the smallest sink in Spain, will they throw the kitchen sink at a place that feels like home?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: We revisit picky postcoder Rupreet and Sundeep at their ever-growing Harrow home, and Laura and Euan, who got their Glasgow gaff for £432,100 to mark the countdown to moving in.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Pep and Malene plan to build a modern Viking Hall in the Surrey Hills. Following Peps cancer diagnosis, its a race to create a house that cherishes their memories and life together.

programme.title: New Zealands Best Homes With Phil Spencer
programme.desc: Phil returns to New Zealand for a VIP tour of the countrys most luxurious properties. In this first episode, Phil explores three incredible beachside homes.

programme.title: Britains Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: The show that takes a lavish peak into extraordinary properties returns. Broker Josh digs deep into his network to close a deal on an £80 million penthouse in Knightsbridge.

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: Two of the fugitives make an unexpected return to Stansted, which features a face to face with the ground hunters. In an Ipswich park, two runners who are laying low are caught in the crosshairs as a hunter team closes in.

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to the Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, which is owned by Phillip Lovingfoss. Hes a wealthy individual with a fleet of classic cars, an array of diamond rings and an apparent drinking problem.

programme.title: 999 Undercover: NHS in Crisis - Dispatches
programme.desc: The truth about overstretched ambulance services is revealed by a Dispatches reporter working undercover inside a 999 control room.

programme.title: Passing
programme.desc: In 1920s New York City, a black woman finds her world upended when her life becomes intertwined with a former childhood friend whos passing as white.

programme.title: Aa Dekhen Zara
programme.desc: Ray possesses an ancestral camera that has the ability to photograph the future, thus striking gold for him! However with wealth, stalks death.

programme.desc: A greedy man plans to have his wife kidnapped by two friends who are also in need of some quick cash.

programme.desc: A hotel worker befriends the man his mother cast him aside for and raised as her own son.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Is Fine

programme.desc: Debras parents come round for Thanksgiving dinner. Debras so pleased that theyre not like Frank and Marie - or are they?

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie mollycoddles Ray when he thinks hes coming down with something, much to Debras despair.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tries to prove his manliness.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is sent to cover the Super Bowl by his newspaper, but his excitement is tempered by having to choose someone to accompany him - will he make the right choice?

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike has trouble dealing with the fact that his childhood friend Nate has more in common with Carter than meets the eye.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike overhears Nikki discussing her boyfriend without realising that she has created a fictitious character based on him.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: The mayor tries to top a promise that two sports heroes make to a sick child but misunderstands what Mike suggests he should do.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.sub-title: Gobbler the Wonder Turkey Saves the Day
programme.desc: A holiday dinner broadcast to stress the mayors commitment to family values goes awry when a fight erupts between the mayor and his father.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. Phoebe meets someone who knows details about her family, Rachel expresses her jealousy of Ross uninhibited girlfriend, and Joey nags the friends into agreeing to play a party game that requires the participants to gradually take off items of clothing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing
programme.desc: Joey argues with the building superintendent Treegar and ends up having to help him practise ballroom dancing. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler cant get out of their gym membership even though neither of them wants to exercise, and Phoebe loses her massage job for kissing a client.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend
programme.desc: Chandler falls for Joeys new date, Ross discovers that the woman that he thinks hes dating actually thinks hes the babysitter, Rachels new college boyfriend steals, and Phoebe tries to re-catch a cold to improve her singing voice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl
programme.desc: Phoebe and Monica decide to go into business together after they cater a funeral where the widow tries not to pay, and Ross date with the beautiful Cheryl goes awry when he kills a rat in her filthy apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line
programme.desc: Chandler finally confesses to his feelings for Kathy just after she splits up with Joey, Ross rediscovers his hopeless musical skills on the keyboard which Phoebe alone appreciates, and Chandler buys new furniture for the apartment since the robbery left them with just the canoe, chick and duck.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Chandler in a Box
programme.desc: The friends have a Thanksgiving meal together, Monica is reminded of Richard when she tries to kiss his son, and Joey frees Chandler from the box that hes being kept in to stop Kathy leaving him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Theyre Going to Party!
programme.desc: Monica upsets Phoebe by stopping the catering business before it has started after she gets the head chef job at a restaurant where the staff all hate her, and Rachels boss is killed in a car accident before she can make Rachel a junior buyer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Girl From Poughkeepsie
programme.desc: Ross struggles to maintain a long-distance relationship, Chandlers well-intended attempts to get Rachel a date seem to miss the mark, and Monicas plan to assert some authority at her new restaurant goes awry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes half-brother makes an astounding announcement and a thought-provoking request, while Joey finds himself in a class struggle.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe undergoes an embryo implant procedure to become a surrogate mother for her brother and his wife, and Monica and Rachel wager their apartment in a trivia game against Chandler and Joey.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel schemes to get a handsome client to ask her on a date, while Chandlers jealousy causes problems with his girlfriend. Elsewhere, after losing a bet, Monica and Rachel must swap their apartment with Chandler and Joeys.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys Dirty Day
programme.desc: Charlton Heston finds Joey in a compromising position during a movie shoot. Meanwhile, Rachel regrets asking Ross for a favour, as he ends up spending the weekend in a Vermont cabin with Emily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Rugby
programme.desc: Ross takes up rugby to impress Emily, and Chandler sets up a ruse to avoid his former girlfriend Janice.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Actor Bradley Walsh and his 20-year-old son Barney are hitting the road together, driving over 2000 miles from Los Angeles to New Orleans. They might be father and son but, when it comes to travelling, they are worlds apart, with Bradley keen to relax while Barney wanting to live life a little more on the edge.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley and Barney saddle up for a Wild West adventure to Arizona. The trip sees them ride Harleys through a desert ghost town and jet ski by Lake Havasus London Bridge, before becoming real-life horsemen at a Cowboy College.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: A topical panel show based on a huge series of opinion polls carried out around Britain. These `Cat Polls are primed to root out the important issues of the day, like what is Britains most unwanted wedding gift or who the British public would most like to have round for dinner. Guests David Hasselhoff, Rachel Riley, Rob Beckett and Justin Moorhouse join the regulars.

programme.title: Iain Stirlings Roast The Internet
programme.sub-title: Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB
programme.desc: Iain is joined by Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB for a no-holds-barred roast of viral chaos and online absurdity.

programme.title: Alan Carr: Spexy Beast Live
programme.desc: After a few years rubbing shoulders with A-list celebrities on his very own chat show, multi award-winning Alan Carr returned to his stand-up roots in 2011 for his first major live comedy tour in four years. Filmed in front of a sold out crowd of 13,000 fans at the Manchester Evening News Arena as part of his 33 date UK and Ireland arena tour, `Spexy Beast sees Alan back on stage.

programme.desc: Marie mollycoddles Ray when he thinks hes coming down with something, much to Debras despair.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tries to prove his manliness.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is sent to cover the Super Bowl by his newspaper, but his excitement is tempered by having to choose someone to accompany him - will he make the right choice?

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike has trouble dealing with the fact that his childhood friend Nate has more in common with Carter than meets the eye.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Mike overhears Nikki discussing her boyfriend without realising that she has created a fictitious character based on him.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: The mayor tries to top a promise that two sports heroes make to a sick child but misunderstands what Mike suggests he should do.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.sub-title: Gobbler the Wonder Turkey Saves the Day

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe invites everyone to stay at her massage clients beach house for the weekend. Phoebe meets someone who knows details about her family, Rachel expresses her jealousy of Ross uninhibited girlfriend, and Joey nags the friends into agreeing to play a party game that requires the participants to gradually take off items of clothing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler and Joey lose all their furniture, Monica finds that one date with her high-school heartthrob is more than enough, and Ross plays tricks on Rachel following their break-up. Elsewhere, Phoebe is temporarily convinced that a cat is the reincarnation of her dead adoptive mother Lily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler has a brief fling with Rachels boss Joanna which leaves him handcuffed without his trousers in her office. Meanwhile, Joey can only afford one book in an encyclopaedia set, and Monica caters a party for her mother.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ballroom Dancing
programme.desc: Joey argues with the building superintendent Treegar and ends up having to help him practise ballroom dancing. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler cant get out of their gym membership even though neither of them wants to exercise, and Phoebe loses her massage job for kissing a client.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys New Girlfriend
programme.desc: Chandler falls for Joeys new date, Ross discovers that the woman that he thinks hes dating actually thinks hes the babysitter, Rachels new college boyfriend steals, and Phoebe tries to re-catch a cold to improve her singing voice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Dirty Girl
programme.desc: Phoebe and Monica decide to go into business together after they cater a funeral where the widow tries not to pay, and Ross date with the beautiful Cheryl goes awry when he kills a rat in her filthy apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Crosses the Line
programme.desc: Chandler finally confesses to his feelings for Kathy just after she splits up with Joey, Ross rediscovers his hopeless musical skills on the keyboard which Phoebe alone appreciates, and Chandler buys new furniture for the apartment since the robbery left them with just the canoe, chick and duck.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Chandler in a Box
programme.desc: The friends have a Thanksgiving meal together, Monica is reminded of Richard when she tries to kiss his son, and Joey frees Chandler from the box that hes being kept in to stop Kathy leaving him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Theyre Going to Party!
programme.desc: Monica upsets Phoebe by stopping the catering business before it has started after she gets the head chef job at a restaurant where the staff all hate her, and Rachels boss is killed in a car accident before she can make Rachel a junior buyer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Girl From Poughkeepsie
programme.desc: Ross struggles to maintain a long-distance relationship, Chandlers well-intended attempts to get Rachel a date seem to miss the mark, and Monicas plan to assert some authority at her new restaurant goes awry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes half-brother makes an astounding announcement and a thought-provoking request, while Joey finds himself in a class struggle.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe undergoes an embryo implant procedure to become a surrogate mother for her brother and his wife, and Monica and Rachel wager their apartment in a trivia game against Chandler and Joey.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel schemes to get a handsome client to ask her on a date, while Chandlers jealousy causes problems with his girlfriend. Elsewhere, after losing a bet, Monica and Rachel must swap their apartment with Chandler and Joeys.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Joeys Dirty Day
programme.desc: Charlton Heston finds Joey in a compromising position during a movie shoot. Meanwhile, Rachel regrets asking Ross for a favour, as he ends up spending the weekend in a Vermont cabin with Emily.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Rugby
programme.desc: Ross takes up rugby to impress Emily, and Chandler sets up a ruse to avoid his former girlfriend Janice.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Actor Bradley Walsh and his 20-year-old son Barney are hitting the road together, driving over 2000 miles from Los Angeles to New Orleans. They might be father and son but, when it comes to travelling, they are worlds apart, with Bradley keen to relax while Barney wanting to live life a little more on the edge.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley and Barney saddle up for a Wild West adventure to Arizona. The trip sees them ride Harleys through a desert ghost town and jet ski by Lake Havasus London Bridge, before becoming real-life horsemen at a Cowboy College.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: A topical panel show based on a huge series of opinion polls carried out around Britain. These `Cat Polls are primed to root out the important issues of the day, like what is Britains most unwanted wedding gift or who the British public would most like to have round for dinner. Guests David Hasselhoff, Rachel Riley, Rob Beckett and Justin Moorhouse join the regulars.

programme.title: Iain Stirlings Roast The Internet
programme.sub-title: Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB
programme.desc: Iain is joined by Jamali Maddix, London Hughes, Josh Jones and Celya AB for a no-holds-barred roast of viral chaos and online absurdity.

programme.title: Alan Carr: Spexy Beast Live
programme.desc: After a few years rubbing shoulders with A-list celebrities on his very own chat show, multi award-winning Alan Carr returned to his stand-up roots in 2011 for his first major live comedy tour in four years. Filmed in front of a sold out crowd of 13,000 fans at the Manchester Evening News Arena as part of his 33 date UK and Ireland arena tour, `Spexy Beast sees Alan back on stage.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer, along with a trusted mechanic, is on a mission to find and restore iconic cars to sell for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead work together to give new life to run-down classic automobiles to resell them at a profit. Working on a tight budget, Mike must find a vehicle for Ant to fix, but that isnt always the easiest task.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Birthday boy Shawn Pomrenke boldly moves back to Tomcod. Fed up with a faulty sluice box, the Kellys resurrect an old piece of equipment called The Coffin. Zeke finds a reef that could yield some great gold, and Chris McCully plans a marathon dive.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Gambling on his ice operation, Shawn must clear the ice on his gold-filled inland claim to avoid bogging down in summertime mud. A crew fight sidelines Verns lucrative run. Chris makes a risky wager that will force him to double his gold goal.

programme.title: Moonshiners

programme.desc: Mike returns Elvis to his F1 roots with a car from one of the most famous names in British racing, Lotus. The Europa, in fact, reckoned to be the first mass-produced mid-engine sports car. Elvis is excited -- until he takes the car out for a spin.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to Long Beach, California, to save Ninos, an Italian family restaurant that was opened in 1958 and is now under the misguided leadership of the eldest son, Nino. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: It was love at first sight when Irish lovebirds Daryl and Clodagh met ten years ago - she was 15 and he was 17. Clodagh pursued her career in medicine and graduated recently, whereas laidback Daryl isnt as ambitious and works as a joiner. Despite being together for ten years, Daryl has remembered Valentines Day just once, and that was only because Clodagh reminded him.

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

programme.title: Jamies Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie travels to Yorkshire, uncovering how the Industrial Revolution, and the need for immigrant workers, changed everything from the people on our streets to the food on our plates. Jamie starts at the Kings Arms pub in the village of Heath where huge Yorkshire puddings are washed down with pints of ale. In Leeds, home to the third-largest Jewish community in Britain, Jamie samples chicken soup and smoked fish.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up a tasty selection of brilliant bowl food; she gets the ball rolling with chicken meatball polenta bowls, teriyaki mushroom and egg bowls and shrimp and veggie grain bowls; plus, Ree whips up cute no-churn ice cream bowls.

programme.title: Jamies Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie makes sticky toffee pudding with his mum Sally. He also rustles up the perfect steak and onion sandwich, and cooks an Italian classic - osso buco with saffron risotto.

programme.title: Jamies Comfort Food
programme.desc: Jamie takes on three comfort food classics. First up is a retro treat: chicken Kiev. He also cooks spaghetti vongole with a non-traditional pink twist, and creates a deluxe shepherds pie - made with slow-roasted lamb shoulder instead of mince.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the worlds most powerful vampire.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: The Emoji Movie
programme.desc: Three emojis embark on an epic adventure through a smartphone to save their world from being deleted.

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn
programme.desc: Tintin and his dog Snowy buy a model of a three-masted sailing ship `The Unicorn at a market and are immediately accosted by two people who both want to buy the model from Tintin. Tintin takes the model ship home and is later shot at and then kidnapped on board a ship with Snowy. Will they escape in time, and solve the mystery of the secret of the Unicorn?

programme.title: Open Season
programme.desc: Stranded in the wilderness, a mule deer and a domesticated bear try to make their way back to the safety of a town preserve before a hunter catches them.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Monster Mayhem
programme.desc: The Dark Knight assembles his heroic friends like Green Arrow and Nightwing to stop the Joker and his cronies from unleashing a diabolical computer virus.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls: Legends of Atlantis
programme.desc: Siren and Mera steal the powerful Book of Legends. The Super Hero Girls head to Atlantis to recover the book before Siren can use it to create an army and take over the entire ocean.

programme.title: Fox and Hare Save the Forest
programme.desc: One day, Fox and Hare discover that Owl has disappeared. They go looking for him in the forest with all their friends and discover a big lake that wasnt there before. It is the beginning of an exciting and funny adventure.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go! and DC Super Hero Girls: Mayhem in the Multiverse
programme.desc: The Super Hero Girls and the Teen Titans reluctantly band together to fight a new threat to the universe.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go! and DC Super Hero Girls: Mayhem in the Multiverse
programme.desc: The Super Hero Girls and the Teen Titans reluctantly band together to fight a new threat to the universe.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
programme.desc: A reporter in Iraq may just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the US Armys New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters whove attacked New York.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: Its Complicated
programme.desc: When attending their sons college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. However, the complication lies in the fact that they are divorced and he has remarried.

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road
programme.desc: David Brent is on tour with his band `Forgone Conclusion. However, tickets sales are not enough to keep the band afloat so Brent has to dip into his pension. Meanwhile, he is being filmed for what he believes will be a documentary, like Martin Scorsese did with The Rolling Stones, but it if for a `where are they now style documentary.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Professor Sherman, a 450lb scientist, falls for his new colleague Professor Carla Purty, but out on a date, hes humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion hes only tested previously on hamsters and - hey presto - he turns into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet, Buddy Love.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: Paul `Wrecking Crewe was a revered football superstar back in his day, but that time has since faded. When a messy drunk driving incident lands him in jail, Paul finds he was specifically requested by Warden Hazen, a duplicitous prison official well aware of Pauls athletic skills. Paul has been assigned the task of assembling a team of convicts, to square off in a big football game against the sadistic guards.

programme.title: One of Them Days
programme.desc: When her boyfriend takes her rent money, Alyssa and her roommate race against the clock to avoid eviction and keep their friendship intact.

programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
programme.desc: An ambitious law graduate decides to leave her job as she feels her skills are not appreciated by her boss, who basically treats her like his PA. However, he wont let her go that easily.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Elizabeth might have her royal rival Mary Queen of Scots in custody, but a far greater threat lies to the east: the Spanish Armada. Despite her reign of 30 years, Elizabeths hold on the English throne remains uncertain. Her kingdom lies in the shadow of mighty Spain, Philip IIs vast army and the Inquisition, but Elizabeth is undaunted.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: A conflicted Navy pilot and veteran of the Second World War questions the role he is forced to play when he is called back into service for the Korean War.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Einar Wegener travels to Germany to undergo one of the first sex-change operations that took place over the course of 2 years.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: Just Friends
programme.desc: An LA record producer returns to his New Jersey hometown ten years after being rejected by his high-school cheerleader crush. Having made the transformation from no-hope geek to Greek god womaniser and with his friend still single, he embarks on a second seduction strategy that does not always go to plan.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Dumped and depressed, English rose Iris agrees to swap homes with similarly unlucky in love Californian Amanda for a much-needed break. Iris finds herself in a palatial Hollywood mansion while Amanda navigates the lanes of a picture-perfect English village. Soon enough, both lovelorn ladies bump into local lads perfect for a romantic pick-me-up.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Following the adventures of The Dreamettes, an all-girl singing group. Theyre going nowhere fast until they meet fast-talking car salesman-come-manager who has ambitions to make a fortune selling black music to a white audience. He persuades them to become backing singers for James `Thunder Early, but the larger-than-life lead singer Effie White must step out of the spotlight in favour of the more image-friendly Deena Jones.

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: With the German Army now just across the Channel, newly-appointed Prime Minister Winston Churchill must decide between negotiating a peace treaty with Hitler or standing firm. With the King, the public and his own political party all questioning his wisdom, the hard-drinking Churchill has to survive his own darkest hour and rally the country behind him.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: Shadowy figures from Christian Greys past threaten to destroy his rekindled romance with Anastasia Steele.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Learning that he has AIDS, Ron Woodroof smuggles medicine into the United States to fight the disease.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Learning that he has AIDS, Ron Woodroof smuggles medicine into the United States to fight the disease.

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Learning that he has AIDS, Ron Woodroof smuggles medicine into the United States to fight the disease.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: A wisecracking parrot caged in a research lab tells his life story to a lonely janitor. Before coming to the science lab, he has passed through the hands of a succession of owners, from a petty criminal to a man who runs a parrot-dancing act. Touched by his colourful story, the janitor conspires to liberate the talking bird.

programme.title: It Takes Two
programme.desc: When a foster child meets the daughter of a bazillionaire, they hatch a plan to solve the problems in their life, and switch identities.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Mr Bean has somehow managed to get a job as a security guard. His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistlers Mother painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Its London in 1904, and writer JM Barrie is inspired by a family he meets, mother Sylvia and her four children, Peter, Jack, George and Michael. From the time he spends with them, he writes the famous childrens novel `Peter Pan.

programme.title: Mr Beans Holiday
programme.desc: Mr Bean is going on holiday to the south of France, looking for a quiet and sunny trip in the Riviera. However, his trip doesnt go as smoothly as he expected when he has to face a series of misunderstandings and totally unfortunate coincidences. Eventually, Mr Bean will end up spoiling the last film of the snobbish director Carson Clay and appearing by accident at the Cannes Film Festival.

programme.title: Cats and Dogs
programme.desc: Unknown to humans, all-out war between cats and dogs has raged since the beginning of time. Now the cats face defeat if scientist Professor Brody can perfect a formula that will make all humans non-allergic to dogs. The cats leader, Mr Tinkles, plans to steal the serum, but first he must get past fearless dog agent Lou who, thanks to a mistake in recruitment, guards the Brody family.

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: A wisecracking parrot caged in a research lab tells his life story to a lonely janitor. Before coming to the science lab, he has passed through the hands of a succession of owners, from a petty criminal to a man who runs a parrot-dancing act. Touched by his colourful story, the janitor conspires to liberate the talking bird.

programme.title: It Takes Two
programme.desc: When a foster child meets the daughter of a bazillionaire, they hatch a plan to solve the problems in their life, and switch identities.

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Two twin brothers, Jared and Simon, and their sister Mallory are relocated by their mother to their great-great uncles creepy home in the middle of nowhere. Exploring, Jared finds his great-great uncles secret study and a book, the `Field Guide to the Fantastical World around Them, which opens up a world of goblins, spirits, ogres, trolls and griffins, some of whom are friendly and helpful and others not.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Charlie Bucket comes from a poor family, and spends most of his time dreaming about the chocolate that he loves but usually cant afford. Things change when Willy Wonka, head of the very popular Wonka Chocolate empire, announces a contest in which five gold tickets have been hidden in chocolate bars. Charlie is one of the five kids who finds a lucky ticket and goes on a tour of Wonkas chocolate factory.

programme.title: Johnny English Reborn
programme.desc: A haphazard spy returns to MI-7 after years in a Tibetan monastery honing his zen skills. Armed with gizmos, gadgets and chaotic luck he takes on a global ring of assassins.

programme.title: Stuart Little
programme.desc: A New York couple go to an orphanage to adopt a brother for their only son, but instead come away with a little mouse. On arrival at his new home, the diminutive rodent receives a lukewarm welcome by the boy - and an even frostier reception from the pet cat. Featuring a mixture of live action and animation.

programme.title: Stuart Little 2
programme.desc: Sequel to the childrens story about the adventures of a small mouse, blending live action and computer-animated characters. The eponymous hero befriends a tiny bird wounded by a sinister falcon, but he must enlist the help of the dreaded family cat if he is to protect his new-found friend.

programme.title: My Penguin Friend
programme.desc: A heartbroken fisherman finds a penguin drifting alone in the ocean, drenched in oil from a spill. He not only rescues the sea creature, but takes it under his wing, finding a sense of joy for the first time in years.

programme.title: Goosebumps
programme.desc: A young kid teams up with the niece of young adult horror author R.L. Stine after the writers imaginary demons are set free on the town of Greendale, Maryland.

programme.title: Goosebumps
